name: treatment of waste polyethylene, open dump, hyperarid infiltration class (-250mm) | waste polyethylene | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/18756/documentation

This dataset represents the activity of waste disposal of 'waste polyethylene' in an open dump. Recommended use of this dataset: for PE, which goes to disposal as part of unmanaged communal waste mixture. Inventoried waste consists of fraction: 100% PE.   ;Waste composition (wet, in ppmw): gross heating value 41.63 MJ/kg; net heating value 39.01 MJ/kg; H2O 4000; O na; H 140500; C 842870; S 488.02; N 692.75; P na; B na; Cl 1505.3; Br 9.8766; F 14.815; I na; Ag na; As 1.7511; Ba 246.91; Cd 34.962; Co 1.7284; Cr 12.84; Cu 42.605; Hg 0.049383; Mn 30.947; Mo na; Ni 0.98766; Pb 23.272; Sb 10.37; Se 1.9354; Sn 3.9282; V 2271.6; Zn 352.24; Be 0.46081; Sc na; Sr 81.563; Ti 921.61; Tl 0.36864; W na; Si na; Fe 1580.3; Ca 2666.7; Al 184.32; K na; Mg 98.766; Na 1350.6.  ;Share of carbon in initial waste that is biogenic 0%. Share of metals in waste not oxidised and bulk-recyclable (exclude very small or thin parts) Iron: 0%; Alu: 0%; Copper: 0%. Overall degradability of waste during 100 years: 1%. 0.001799 kg waste mass remains in the landfill even after the long term period.

The activity starts with the waste being available at the location (gate) of the uncontrolled disposal. Collection and transportation of the waste to the uncontrolled disposal location is not included.

The activity ends with the waste being disposed, in an uncontrolled manner and waste-specific emissions from open dump are released to air via gas, air and soil via windblown evaporites, and to groundwater.
category: E:Water supply; sewerage, waste management and remediation activities/38:Waste collection, treatment and disposal activities; materials recovery/382:Waste treatment and disposal/3821:Treatment and disposal of non-hazardous waste

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: This dataset represents an open dump location of 'infiltration class 1 hyperarid (2018)'. Landfill site with mean annual temperature (MAT) of 8 degC, mean annual precipitation (MAP) of 350 mm/year, and net infiltration of -250 mm/year. Negative infiltration means that leachate flow in landfill is reversed and flows upward to the surface, where waste is evaporated and dissolved solids become solid evaporites. ;Temperature at site can result in permafrost conditions, which slows down water flow by a factor of (alpha t) 0.999. Total climate adjustments with alpha pt of 0.999. The leachate percolating through the landfill has an average residence time of 7.01 years.;Reference for climatic parameters: Doka, G., 2018, Inventory parameters for regionalised waste disposal mixes
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: This is an inventory for an open, uncontrolled waste dump for municipal solid waste. Ultimate average landfill height is 7 meters. Operation phase duration is 15 years. The total, waste-specific raw landfill gas mass produced in the landfill is 0.009538 kg. The total CH4 mass in the raw landfill gas is 0.008173 kg. Percentage of landfill gas directly emitted is 100w%. A Methane Correction Factor (MCF) for landfill air emissions of 0.7057 is employed. Leachate of the landfill is not treated, but emitted untreated. Leachate flow is upward to the surface due to net negative infiltration. No leachate treatment can be performed. Based on average waste composition and chosen climate data the end of carbonate phase is estimated to be reached 3'171 years after waste deposition. Arid conditions at this location prompt formation of evaporites from landfill contents which are partially eroded by wind. It is assumed that 10% of these evaporites are eroded by wind and airborne. Initial decay in the first 100 years of this waste results in a wind erosion rate corresponding to 3.274 g/m2.year and long-term decay corresponds to wind erosion of 11.54 g/m2.year.
